function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Urban expansion encroaches on wildlife habitat, creating wuis. human activities in these \\'buffer zones\\' create stress for wild animals, facilitating viral shedding.","category":"Urbanization and habitat loss","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced biodiversity depletes the possibility of alternate hosts for disease transmission.","category":"Biodiversity and ecological impacts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Zoonotic disease emergence and interspecific disease transmission","category":"Biodiversity and ecological impacts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Air pollution, including particulate matter and other pollutants, has been linked to increased severity and transmission of covid-19.","category":"Air quality and pollution effects","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human settlement and activity increase human-wildlife interfaces and facilitate interspecific pathogen transmission","category":"Urbanization and habitat loss","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral shedding and mutation due to human disturbances to habitats and animal hosts","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High concentration of inorganic compounds for disinfection","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Origin of sars-cov from bats and transmission through intermediate sources like palm civets","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Violation of ecosystem due to large human population gathering and intervention","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of design considerations for urban green spaces in the post-pandemic era","category":"Urbanization and habitat loss","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Association between indoor and outdoor green features and self-reported change in psychological outcomes related to the covid-19 lockdown","category":"Energy consumption and sustainability issues","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent evidence on the effects of outdoor green spaces on psychological and mental health","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited studies on the effect of green spaces on mental health when access to public residential green spaces is not allowed","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Poor mental and emotional health due to lack of access to natural light and green views","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Association between green view and psychological health outcomes","category":"Energy consumption and sustainability issues","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of indoor plants correlated with positive emotions","category":"Energy consumption and sustainability issues","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential rebound effects of evs leading to increased emissions and environmental impact","category":"Energy consumption and sustainability issues","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Constant changes in the environment leading to the need for adaptive architecture","category":"Climate change effects","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex relationship between antibiotic concentrations and resistance in wastewater","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Seasonal variations in antibiotic resistance genes args in wastewater","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Prevalence of antimicrobial resistance genes args in influent wastewater","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlations between antibiotic levels and abundance of args in wastewater","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Antiviral drugs like tamiflu and relenza are stockpiled globally and deployed during pandemics, leading to high proportions of communities taking the drugs in a short time window, resulting in the drugs and their metabolites being present in wastewater.","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Antiviral drugs, if present in low levels in the environment, could cause irreversible effects to viral genomes, leading to resistance.","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of antiviral drugs and their metabolized forms in wastewater streams contribute to environmental contamination and potential long-term impacts on microbial resistance.","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on antibiotic metabolites in wastewater analysis","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear impact of antibiotic usage on bacterial communities in wwtps","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited understanding of proteins in wastewater","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of investigation into stability of proteins in sewage systems","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Sewage system containing complex microbial communities","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of water fingerprinting for community-wide infectious disease diagnostics","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of wastewater-based epidemiology wbe techniques for biomarker selection","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential contamination of water sources with harmful chemicals or biological compounds.","category":"Pollution increase","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient environmental monitoring of potential hazards in built environments","category":"Pollution increase","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inherent consumption and sustainability issues","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Anthropogenic impacts on water resources","category":"Pollution increase","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Drugs used for treatment of
